intro: Adenophora triphylla f. leucantha, commonly known as the white flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
